key_points: A shooting occurred around 10:30 p.m. Saturday in Jackson, resulting in the death of Antoinette Robinson.
Three more people were found dead from gunshot wounds around 12:30 a.m. Sunday on Britton Street, Jackson.
Mississippi Supreme Court made changes affecting the transparency of findings of unethical behavior during judicial campaigns.
Previously, a five-person committee monitored judicial races for a single election year; now, a nine-person committee will serve multiple years.
Judicial candidates in Mississippi are restricted in their campaign promises by the Code of Judicial Conduct.
Ethan Crumbley, a 15-year-old, is charged as an adult with murder and terrorism for the shooting at Oxford High School, Michigan.
The shooting at Oxford High School resulted in four students killed and seven others wounded.
Crumbley was due in court for a procedural hearing, with a significant hearing scheduled for Dec. 20 to decide on a trial.
The potential for a mental competency exam for Crumbley could put the case on hold.
Changes in Mississippi judicial race oversight aim to address the influence of money in elections but reduce public information on unethical conduct.
spokespersons: Deputy Chief Deric Hearn (Jackson Police Department)
